definition: seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: Sorry, sleepers are all sold out. We have only soft seats left.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，卧铺票已经卖完了，只有软座。

sentences.english: Today, the railway passenger transport offer people hard seat and soft seat.
sentences.chinese: 今天铁路客运有硬座和软座之分。

sentences.english: I want to book a sleeper ticket for chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我不需要卧铺，可软座我是要的。

sentences.english: A soft-seat car holds less people.
sentences.chinese: 软座车容纳的旅客要少些。

sentences.english: Then how about hard-seat and soft-seat cars?
sentences.chinese: 那么硬座和软座车厢又怎么样呢？

sentences.english: It is a high-class train with air conditioner and soft seat.
sentences.chinese: 那是我坐过的比较高档的空调软座火车。

sentences.english: A hard-seat car is a car with semi-cushioned seats.
sentences.chinese: 硬座和软座车厢又怎么样呢？

definition: hard sleeper (a type of sleeper train ticket class with a harder bunk)
soft sleeper (a type of sleeper train ticket class with a softer bunk)
soft seat (= first class in PRC trains)
soft seat (= first class in PRC trains)
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
green train (slow, noisy, unairconditioned train with forest green livery and yellow trim that ran on the Chinese railway system from the 1950s, phased out in the early 21st century)
